alert.note: Alert for Benton; Buchanan; Cedar; Delaware; Dubuque; Iowa; Jackson; Johnson; Jones; Keokuk; Linn (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 05 at 6:31AM CST by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Buchanan, west central Jackson, northwestern Cedar, northwestern Keokuk, Dubuque, northern Johnson, eastern Benton, Jones, Delaware, Linn and Iowa Counties through 730 AM CST... At 630 AM CST, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Ryan to near Millersburg. Movement was northeast at 50 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Coggon, Ryan and Masonville around 635 AM CST. Manchester around 640 AM CST. Delhi, Delaware and Oneida around 645 AM CST. Earlville, Oxford, Greeley and Amana around 650 AM CST. Other locations in the path of these storms include Dyersville, Tiffin, North Liberty, Swisher, Shueyville, New Vienna, Colesburg, Luxemburg, Lake Macbride State Park, Solon, Ely, Holy Cross, Bertram, Rickardsville and Balltown. This includes the following highways... Interstate 80 in Iowa between mile markers 209 and 235. Interstate 380 between mile markers 2 and 50. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Benton; Buchanan; Cedar; Delaware; Dubuque; Iowa; Jackson; Johnson; Jones; Keokuk; Linn
